intro: Anneslia purpurea, commonly known as the purple anneslia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its striking violet to purple flowers. The plant typically grows as an annual herb with lance-shaped leaves and branched stems. Its flowers are borne in whorls along the stem, adding to its ornamental appeal. Anneslia purpurea thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and borders.
